B2 to make someone stop giving their attention to something: Don't distract her (from her studies). He tried to distract attention from his own illegal activities.
More examplesFewer examplesThe teacher had to separate the two friends because they tend to distract each other in class.Shoplifters often work in pairs, with one creating a diversion to distract the shop assistants while the other steals the goods.Can you stop tapping your foot please - it's distracting me while I'm working.Sorry, what were you saying? Something outside the window distracted me.If the TV is distracting you from your homework, turn it off.
